newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Hapoalim Investments nets $23.5 mln from Teledata.
newsitem.headline: Hapoalim Investments nets $23.5 mln from Teledata.

text.p: The Investment Company of Bank Hapoalim said it will make a net profit of $23.5 million from the public offering of Teledata Communications Ltd on Nasdaq.
The offering for 2.76 million shares was priced at $26, raising a total of $72 million.
Hapoalim Investments offered 800,000 of its shares in Israel's Teledata. Hapoalim subsidiary Ofir Holdings offered 860,000 and Teledata issued the remaining 1.1 million.
After the offering Hapoalim Investments' stake in Teledata fell to 22.6 percent, including the shares controlled by Ofir.
This does not include the 414,000 additional shares which Teledata granted an option to the underwriters to purchase to cover over-allotments.
